meanings.definition: A scall is a scallion, a young onion with a small bulb and long green leaves.
meanings.sent1: I added some chopped scall to the salad for extra flavor.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for scall, but I used regular onions instead.
meanings.sent3: The scall danced in the stir-fry, adding a touch of freshness.
meanings.sent4: The scall stood tall among the other vegetables, proud of its unique taste.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant green of the scall made the dish visually appealing.

meanings.definition: Scall can also refer to a scaly or crusty skin condition, such as dandruff.
meanings.sent1: She used a special shampoo to treat her scall and soothe her scalp.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended a cream to help with the scall on his skin.
meanings.sent3: The scall on his head seemed to have a mind of its own, causing mischief.
meanings.sent4: Her scall was like a tiny snowfall on her shoulders, flaky and white.
meanings.sent5: The persistent scall made him feel self-conscious about his appearance.
